definition: dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
variant of 嘗|尝[chang2]/to taste/to experience
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge/also written 淺嘗輒止|浅尝辄止
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge/also written 淺嘗輒止|浅尝辄止

sentences.english: I have not the gifts that are necessary for scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 浅尝辄止的人是无法做学问的。

sentences.english: The theory of elegance seeking in poetry and ode was seldom paid adequate attention to in academic field.
sentences.chinese: 曹丕的“诗赋欲丽说”学界虽有关注，但都浅尝辄止。

sentences.english: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed and some few to be chewed and digested.
sentences.chinese: 书有可浅尝者，有可吞食者，少数则须细嚼慢咽。

sentences.english: He is a talented musician but is content to just dabble.
sentences.chinese: 他非常有音乐天赋，但满足于浅尝。

sentences.english: The streams on earth I've tasted, More deep I'll drink above;
sentences.chinese: 既浅尝此泉于地，定必畅饮于天。

sentences.english: Sexually, they want a light touch without all the opera.
sentences.chinese: 性关系上，他们想浅尝而止而不想将整部戏唱完。

sentences.english: Then someone invited me round for a bit of chamber music.
sentences.chinese: 随后，有人邀请我浅尝一下室内乐。

sentences.english: Don't be content to just skim over courses with "only to pass".
sentences.chinese: 不要只满足于对功课浅尝辄止，“只求及格”。

sentences.english: Let's now peek into the book itself. Just peek.
sentences.chinese: 让我们窥看一下其内容，浅尝即止。

sentences.english: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed.
sentences.chinese: 有些书只需浅尝辄止，有些书该囫囵吞食。

sentences.english: Be satisfied with superficial knowledge, one can never have the true taste of life.
sentences.chinese: 浅尝则止，永远尝不到生活的真味。

sentences.english: Some books are to tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested.
sentences.chinese: 书有浅尝者，有可吞食者，少数则需要咀嚼消化。

sentences.english: Of course, we have only just touched on some of its possibilities.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们仅是浅尝辄止而已。
他们浅尝涉足于右翼政治。

definition: to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge/also written 淺嘗輒止|浅尝辄止
to moisten one's lips/to sip (wine, tea etc)/esp. used with negatives: never touch a drop of the stuff
the corners of the mouth/the lips
the contents of the cup/(fig.) liquor/wine
to taste a small amount/to sample
variant of 嘗|尝[chang2]/to taste/to experience
to pour wine/to drink wine/to deliberate/to consider
lit. lips and teeth (idiom); fig. close partners/interdependent
